Delphox, the Fox Pokémon and the final evolved form of Fennekin. It is a dual-type Fire/Psychic Pokémon. Delphox's appearance is reminiscent of a mage or sorcerer, with long, flowing, fiery red fur and a robe-like coat. It holds a staff-like stick, which it uses to channel its psychic powers. Delphox is highly intelligent and possesses incredible mystical abilities.

Froakie, the Bubble Frog Pokémon. It is a Water type. Froakie is a small, blue frog with white and yellow accents. It is known for its powerful legs, which allow it to leap high and move quickly through water. Froakie can produce bubbles from the fringes of its mouth, which it uses for a variety of offensive and defensive moves.

Frogadier, the Bubble Frog Pokémon and the evolved form of Froakie. It maintains its Water type. Frogadier is a sleek and agile Pokémon, resembling a ninja. It possesses heightened speed and agility, allowing it to swiftly outmaneuver its foes. Frogadier's fringes can now produce larger and more powerful bubbles, which it can manipulate with precision and skill.

Greninja, the Ninja Pokémon and the final evolved form of Froakie. It is a dual-type Water/Dark Pokémon. Greninja has a dark blue body with sleek and muscular features. It is a master of stealth, capable of moving silently and invisibly. Greninja's bubble-based attacks have evolved into a unique form called Water Shuriken, in which it hurls sharp blades of water at its enemies with incredible speed.

Bunnelby, the Digging Pokémon. It is a Normal type. Bunnelby is a small, brown rabbit with long ears and powerful digging claws. It is known for its impressive digging skills, which it uses to create complex underground tunnels. Bunnelby's ears can rotate independently, allowing it to detect even the slightest sounds and vibrations in its surroundings.

Diggersby, the Digging Pokémon and the evolved form of Bunnelby. It remains a Normal type. Diggersby is a larger and more muscular rabbit with even stronger digging claws. Its digging prowess has reached new heights, enabling it to excavate deep tunnels and create intricate underground networks. Diggersby's ears are now equipped with powerful muscles, allowing it to deliver devastating blows with its ear punches.

Fletchling, the Tiny Robin Pokémon. It is a Normal/Flying type. Fletchling is small with a reddish-orange body and a white underside. It has a sharp beak that it uses to catch insects for food. Fletchling is known for its energetic and playful nature. As it evolves, it gains the ability to control its fire energy.

Fletchinder, the Ember Pokémon and the evolved form of Fletchling. It remains a dual-type Normal/Flying Pokémon. Fletchinder has an orange body with additional fiery red plumage on its head and tail. It is a fast and agile Pokémon that can fly at incredible speeds. Fletchinder uses its flames to intimidate opponents and mark its territory.

Talonflame, the Scorching Pokémon and the final evolved form of Fletchling. It is a dual-type Fire/Flying Pokémon. Talonflame has a powerful and majestic appearance with a reddish-brown body and vibrant orange wings. This Pokémon is known for its incredible speed and agility in the sky. Talonflame is often seen diving down from above to catch prey with its sharp talons.

Scatterbug, the Scatterdust Pokémon. It is a Bug type. Scatterbug has a small creamy-white body covered in tiny black speckles. It is known for its soft and gentle nature. Scatterbug releases a powder from its body that acts as a defensive mechanism against predators. As it evolves, Scatterbug transforms into a beautiful and highly adaptable Bug-type Pokémon.

Spewpa, the Scatterdust Pokémon and the evolved form of Scatterbug. It remains a Bug type. Spewpa has a round, cocoon-like body covered in soft fur. This Pokémon is known for its ability to completely blend in with its surroundings, making it difficult to spot. Spewpa uses its fur to sense slight changes in temperature and humidity. Its evolved form is capable of unleashing powerful attacks using its hidden strength.

Vivillon, the Scale Pokémon. It is a Bug/Flying type. Vivillon boasts a vibrant color palette, with its wings adorned with intricate patterns that vary depending on its habitat. This Pokémon can change the patterns on its wings by sipping nectar from different flowers. Vivillon's graceful flight and mesmerizing patterns make it a delightful sight to behold.

Litleo, the Lion Cub Pokémon. It is a Fire/Normal type. Litleo resembles a young lion with its golden fur and a majestic fiery mane. This Pokémon emits a loud and intimidating roar to mark its territory and communicate with others. Litleo possesses a fierce and brave nature that is reflected in its battle strategies.

Pyroar, the Royal Pokémon and the evolved form of Litleo. It retains its Fire/Normal typing. Pyroar is known for its majestic appearance, resembling a regal lion with an impressive fiery mane. This Pokémon exudes an aura of authority and will fiercely protect its pride. Pyroar's roar is so powerful that it can intimidate even the strongest opponents.

Flabebe, the Single Bloom Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Flabebe appears as a small fairy-like creature that carries a single flower. This Pokémon forms an unbreakable bond with its chosen flower and will search for a new one if its current flower is lost or wilted. Flabebe's flower also serves as a source of energy and allows it to perform enchanting Fairy-type moves.

Floette, the Single Bloom Pokémon and the evolved form of Flabebe. It maintains its Fairy typing. Floette stands out with its elegant and graceful appearance, adorned with a vibrant flower. This Pokémon can change the color of its flower depending on its emotions. Floette is known for its caring nature and will go to great lengths to protect its Trainer and friends.

Florges is known as the Garden Pokémon. It is a Fairy type Pokémon and is the evolved form of Floette. Florges has a graceful appearance, with vibrant flower petals forming its body and a delicate crown on its head. It uses the flowers on its head to communicate with its kin, and its pollen has a soothing effect on those around it.

Skiddo is a Grass type Pokémon. It is known as the Mount Pokémon, as it is often used as a reliable mode of transportation in mountainous regions. Skiddo has a playful and energetic nature, and its ability to jump great distances allows it to effortlessly navigate tough terrains. It is highly loyal to its trainer and is always eager to assist.

Gogoat is the evolved form of Skiddo and retains its Grass type. It is often referred to as the Mount Pokémon. Gogoat resembles a large, majestic goat with a set of impressive horns. Its strong and sturdy build make it a dependable ride for humans and Pokémon alike. Gogoat's thick fur provides insulation and protection against harsh weather conditions.

Pancham, the Playful Pokémon, is a Fighting type Pokémon. It has a mischievous nature and likes to challenge and wrestle with fellow Pokémon. Pancham's round body is complemented by its prominent ears and expressive eyes. It fiercely protects its friends and is known to become stronger when it is battling alongside a partner it trusts.

Pangoro is the evolved form of Pancham, retaining its Fighting type. It is known as the Daunting Pokémon due to its intimidating appearance. Pangoro is a large and powerful Pokémon with a stern expression, sporting a red cape-like feature around its neck. It has a strong sense of justice and protects weaker Pokémon from bullies without hesitation.

Furfrou, the Poodle Pokémon. It is a Normal type. Furfrou is known for its beautiful and fluffy white fur, which it maintains by grooming itself in various unique styles. Its fur can be trimmed and shaped according to its Trainer's preferences. Furfrou's fur serves as a protective shield, enabling it to resist scratches and even reduce the power of special moves.

Espurr, the Restraint Pokémon. It is a Psychic type. Espurr has a small, round body covered in pale gray fur. Despite its innocent appearance, its eyes emit an intense psychic power that can cause headaches and discomfort to those around it. Espurr rarely shows its true emotions, keeping a masked expression that hints at its mysterious and powerful psychic abilities.

Meowstic, the Constraint Pokémon and the male form of Meowstic. It is a Psychic type. Meowstic males have a sleek and elegant appearance, with a dark blue body covered in intricate patterns. They possess highly developed psychic abilities, which they use to protect their territory and communicate with others. Meowstic males are incredibly intelligent and strategic in battle.

Honedge, the Sword Pokémon. It is a Steel/Ghost type. Honedge resembles a sentient sword, with its blade serving as its body. It has the ability to attach itself to the arm of a Trainer and become an efficient weapon. Honedge absorbs the energy of living creatures, which gives it strength and allows it to move and battle on its own.

Doublade, the Sword Pokémon and the evolved form of Honedge. It remains a dual-type Steel/Ghost Pokémon. Doublade is formed when two Honedge combine into a single body, creating a double-bladed sword. It has increased strength and can swing its blades with incredible precision. Doublade's eerie appearance and razor-sharp blades make it a formidable opponent in battle.

Aegislash-Shield, the Royal Sword Pokémon. It is a dual-type Steel/Ghost Pokémon. Aegislash-Shield wields a majestic shield known as the Aegis Shield, which is said to possess the power to negate any attack. This Pokémon prefers to stand in a defensive stance, using its shield to deflect and counter enemy strikes. It is known to be incredibly loyal to its Trainer.

Spritzee, the Perfume Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Spritzee is characterized by its elegant appearance and sweet fragrance. It has pink plumage and a unique beak resembling a perfume bottle. Spritzee produces a special fragrance that can have various effects on those who inhale it. This Pokémon is highly sought after for its aromatic properties and is often used in perfumes and aromatherapy.

Aromatisse, the Fragrance Pokémon and the evolved form of Spritzee. It remains a Fairy type. Aromatisse is known for its mesmerizing scent, which it emits from its large, fluffy tuft. This Pokémon's fragrance has soothing and calming effects, often helping individuals relax and feel at ease. Aromatisse is also said to have the power to enhance the scents of other Pokémon, making them more attractive to potential mates.

Swirlix, the Cotton Candy Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Swirlix resembles a fluffy cloud of cotton candy, complete with its whimsical appearance and sweet scent. This Pokémon's cotton-like body is not only adorable but also acts as a natural lure, attracting prey. Swirlix spins its body rapidly to create a sugary thread, which it uses to ensnare and immobilize its opponents.

Slurpuff, the Meringue Pokémon and the evolved form of Swirlix. It remains a Fairy type. Slurpuff is known for its ability to detect the subtlest of sweet scents, making it an excellent tracker of delicious treats. This Pokémon has a large, strawberry-shaped hat on its head, which it uses to enhance its sense of smell. Slurpuff's fur-covered body is highly fluffy and has a unique texture similar to whipped cream.

Inkay, the Revolving Pokémon. It is a Dark/Psychic type. Inkay is a small, cephalopod-like creature with a unique ability to rotate its body. It has a pale blue coloration, with large, expressive eyes on the top of its head. Inkay uses hypnotic powers to confuse its opponents and escape from danger. As it evolves, Inkay gains more control over its psychic abilities.

Malamar, the Overturning Pokémon and the evolved form of Inkay. It remains a Dark/Psychic type. Malamar possesses a sinister appearance, with a dark blue body covered in intricate patterns. It uses its powerful psychic abilities to control the minds of others and manipulate them to its advantage. Malamar's hypnotic powers are so strong that it can even bend the will of its opponents, forcing them to act against their own desires.

Binacle, the Two-Handed Pokémon. It is a Rock/Water type. Binacle is a small, dual-bodied crustacean with two pairs of hands. It lives in rocky areas near the sea and attaches itself to the rocks using its powerful arms. Binacle can move its hands independently and uses them to catch prey and defend itself. When Binacle evolves, its two bodies merge into one, forming a more powerful Pokémon.

Barbaracle, the Collective Pokémon and the evolved form of Binacle. It remains a Rock/Water type. Barbaracle is a unique Pokémon with a large, central body and multiple heads and arms. It lives in colonies and works together with its fellow Barbaracle to catch prey and defend its territory. Each head has its own brain and can make independent decisions, making Barbaracle a formidable opponent in battle.

Skrelp, the Mock Kelp Pokémon. It is a Poison/Water type. Skrelp resembles a small seaweed or kelp, which helps it camouflage itself in its ocean habitat. It is a master of disguise, able to blend in perfectly with its surroundings. Skrelp produces a poisonous substance from its skin, which it uses to deter predators. When threatened, it releases a foul stench to drive away enemies.

Dragalge, the Mock Kelp Pokémon. It is a dual-type Poison/Dragon Pokemon. Dragalge is characterized by its long, thin body covered in seaweed-like appendages. Its vivid colors and unique appearance help it blend into its surroundings in the ocean. Dragalge's toxic barbs can cause severe poisoning to any Pokemon that comes into contact with them.

Clauncher, the Water Gun Pokémon. It is a pure Water type. Clauncher is a small crab-like Pokemon with a bright blue body and a large claw. It uses its oversized claw to launch powerful water-based attacks at its opponents. Clauncher is commonly found in coastal areas and its claw can shoot water bullets with enough force to break rocks.

Clawitzer, the Howitzer Pokémon and the evolved form of Clauncher. It retains its pure Water typing. Clawitzer is a large, blue lobster-like Pokemon with powerful claws. Its massive claw can propel water projectiles with incredible force and accuracy, making it an excellent long-range attacker. Clawitzer's accuracy is unmatched, and it is capable of hitting targets from over 300 feet away.

Helioptile, the Generator Pokémon. It is a dual-type Electric/Normal Pokemon. Helioptile has a small, lizard-like body covered in yellow and orange scales. It can generate energy from the sun and convert it into electric charges. Helioptile's fringed ears are extremely sensitive to electric changes in the atmosphere, allowing it to detect incoming storms.

Heliolisk, the Generator Pokémon and the evolved form of Helioptile. It maintains its dual-type Electric/Normal typing. Heliolisk has a sleek, lizard-like body with vibrant yellow scales. It has the ability to absorb sunlight and convert it into energy, making it a formidable solar-powered Pokemon. Heliolisk's fringed ears can rotate 360 degrees, allowing it to pick up even the faintest sounds.

Tyrunt, the Royal Heir Pokémon. It is a Rock/Dragon type. Tyrunt resembles a small dinosaur with a spiky crown on its head. This Pokémon is known for its playful and mischievous nature. Tyrunt has strong jaws, which it uses to crush rocks and prey. As it evolves, Tyrunt grows larger and more ferocious.

Tyrantrum, the Despot Pokémon and the evolved form of Tyrunt. It remains a Rock/Dragon type. Tyrantrum is a massive and imposing Pokémon resembling a Tyrannosaurus rex. Its strong jaw and powerful teeth make it a fearsome predator. Legends tell of Tyrantrum's reign as the king of the ancient Pokémon, ruling over its domain with pride and power.

Amaura, the Tundra Pokémon. It is a Rock/Ice type. Amaura has a beautiful and elegant appearance, with a long neck and blue crystalline structures on its body. This Pokémon emits an aura that can soothe even the tensest of disputes. Amaura hails from the ancient times and is believed to have lived in cold, snowy regions.

Aurorus, the Tundra Pokémon and the evolved form of Amaura. It remains a Rock/Ice type. Aurorus boasts a majestic presence, with a large and radiant sail atop its back. This Pokémon possesses a gentle and compassionate nature, often using its ice powers to create beautiful landscapes and sculptures. Aurorus is revered as a symbol of grace and tranquility.

Sylveon, the Intertwining Pokémon and a Fairy-type Eeveelution. Sylveon has a graceful and elegant appearance, adorned with ribbons and bows. This Pokémon's ribbon-like feelers can sense the emotions of others, allowing it to empathize and comfort those in need. Sylveon's charming personality and mesmerizing beauty make it a sought-after companion.

Hawlucha, the Wrestling Pokémon. It is a Fighting/Flying type. Hawlucha is known for its impressive acrobatic skills and its passion for battling. With its vibrant green and white feathers, Hawlucha resembles a luchador wrestler. It is incredibly agile and can perform various aerial maneuvers in battle, using its powerful kicks and quick punches to take down opponents.

Dedenne, the Antenna Pokémon. It is an Electric/Fairy type. Dedenne is a small, mouse-like Pokémon with a round body covered in yellow fur. It has long, rabbit-like ears that function as antennas, allowing it to communicate with others using electrical signals. Dedenne is highly social and often forms groups with other Dedenne, creating a network of electrical currents to power their habitats.

Carbink, the Jewel Pokémon. It is a Rock/Fairy type. Carbink resembles a small, gray rock with crystalline formations on its body. It has the unique ability to create diamonds by compressing carbon under its body. Carbink is rarely seen by humans as it likes to live deep underground, finding solace in the darkness. Legends say that Carbink can grant eternal youth to those who possess its diamond.

Goomy, the Soft Tissue Pokémon. It is a Dragon type. Goomy is a small, gelatinous Pokémon that has a slimy body. Due to its weak constitution, Goomy prefers to hide in damp and humid places. It feeds on leaves and moisture in the air to grow and gain strength. Goomy's skin is very sensitive, and it secretes a protective slimy substance to keep itself safe from harm.

Sliggoo, the Soft Tissue Pokémon and the evolved form of Goomy. It remains a Dragon type. Sliggoo is larger and more developed than its previous form, with a slimy, gelatinous body covered in greenish-blue slimy mucus. This mucus serves as a protective barrier against harsh weather conditions. Sliggoo's slimy membrane allows it to move smoothly and quickly, making it a formidable opponent in battle.

Goodra, the Dragon Pokémon. It is a pure Dragon type. Goodra is a slimy and viscous Pokémon that resembles a purple, bipedal dragon. It has a kind and gentle nature, and despite its intimidating appearance, it is actually quite friendly and sociable. Goodra's body is capable of transforming into a sticky slime, which it uses for protection and to trap its opponents.

Klefki, the Key Ring Pokémon. It is a Steel/Fairy type. Klefki is a small, fairy-like Pokémon that resembles a keychain with several keys attached to it. This mischievous Pokémon is known for its curiosity and love for collecting keys. It is said that each key it possesses has a different power. Klefki often helps people by unlocking doors or solving puzzles with its keys.

Phantump, the Stump Pokémon. It is a Ghost/Grass type. Phantump is a small Pokémon that resembles a tree stump with a ghostly face carved into it. It is said that Phantump is the spirit of a child who got lost in the forest and became a part of the tree. Phantump can mimic the voice of a child, luring unsuspecting people into the forest. Its presence brings a mysterious and eerie atmosphere.

Trevenant, the Elder Tree Pokémon and the evolved form of Phantump. It remains a dual-type Ghost/Grass Pokémon. Trevenant is a towering tree-like Pokémon with a long, twisted body. It is known as the protector of the forest and is said to punish those who harm the trees. Trevenant can control tree roots and branches to attack its enemies. It has a strong connection to nature and the spirit world.

Pumpkaboo, the Pumpkin Pokémon. It is a Ghost/Grass type. Pumpkaboo is a small Pokémon that resembles a pumpkin with a face carved into it. There are different sizes of Pumpkaboo, and the 'average' size is the most common. Pumpkaboo often wanders around at night, scaring unsuspecting humans and Pokémon. It has the ability to create illusions and change its size, using these tricks to its advantage in battles.

Gourgeist, the Pumpkin Pokémon. It is a Ghost/Grass type. Gourgeist has a round, orange body that resembles a pumpkin. It has a large, toothy grin and glowing, triangular eyes. Gourgeist's body is hollow and can be used to emit eerie sounds, which it uses to scare its opponents. This Pokémon also has the ability to manipulate its size, which increases its effectiveness in battle.

Bergmite, the Ice Chunk Pokémon. It is an Ice type. Bergmite is a small, blue and white Pokémon that resembles an ice cube. It has a crystalline body that is extremely cold to the touch. Bergmite's body can endure harsh cold temperatures, allowing it to survive in frigid environments. This Pokémon uses its icy body to launch powerful attacks, capable of freezing its opponents solid.

Avalugg, the Iceberg Pokémon and the evolved form of Bergmite. It remains an Ice type. Avalugg is a massive Pokémon that resembles a large, floating iceberg. Its body is covered in a thick layer of icy armor, making it incredibly durable. Avalugg is known for its colossal strength, capable of crushing anything in its path. Despite its slow speed, it uses its icy powers to create a freezing field around itself.

Noibat, the Sound Wave Pokémon. It is a Flying/Dragon type. Noibat is a small, bat-like Pokémon with lavender skin. It has large, reddish eyes and pointed ears. Noibat uses ultrasonic waves to navigate in the dark, as it is highly sensitive to sound. This Pokémon is nocturnal and primarily active at night. Noibat can generate powerful sound-based attacks to defend itself and confuse its opponents.

Noivern, the Sound Wave Pokémon and the evolved form of Noibat. It remains a dual-type Flying/Dragon Pokémon. Noivern is a large, bat-like Pokémon with a dark purple body and turquoise wings. It has sharp fangs and an intimidating appearance. Noivern has the ability to emit ultrasonic waves of intense power, which it uses both for echolocation and as a devastating attack. This Pokémon is known for its agility and fierce battle tactics.

Xerneas, the Life Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Xerneas is known for its graceful and majestic appearance, with an elegant pair of antlers that emit a glowing aura. This Pokémon has the ability to share eternal life and restore life energy to living beings. Legends say that Xerneas's presence brings forth beautiful and flourishing forests wherever it goes.

Yveltal, the Destruction Pokémon. It is a Dark/Flying type. Yveltal is known for its massive wingspan and menacing appearance. Its wings possess the power to absorb life force from all living things, leading to its title as the bringer of destruction. Legends say that when Yveltal spreads its wings and takes flight, it has the ability to drain the life energy of all living creatures around it.

Zygarde 50% Forme, the Order Pokémon. It is a Dragon/Ground type. This form of Zygarde resembles a large serpent-like creature. Its body is covered in green hexagonal scales that are said to represent the order and balance of the ecosystem. Zygarde-50 has the ability to detect and monitor disturbances in nature, and it can take action to restore peace and order when necessary.

Diancie, the Jewel Pokémon. It is a Rock/Fairy type. Diancie is known for its rare and exquisite diamond-like body, which is said to be the hardest substance in the world. Legends say that Diancie has the power to create diamonds and gemstones, using its mystical abilities to manipulate carbon. It can also create barriers of diamond that are impenetrable to protect itself and its allies.

Hoopa, the Mischief Pokémon. It is a Psychic/Ghost type. Hoopa possesses the ability to warp space and time, allowing it to carry objects and even people through its rings. Legends say that Hoopa delights in mischievous pranks and has been known to cause chaos by stealing valuable items and transporting them to hidden locations. It is said that only those who can earn Hoopa's trust can witness its true power.

Volcanion, the Steam Pokémon. It is a dual-type Fire/Water Pokémon. Volcanion is known for its unique ability to create and manipulate steam. Its body is primarily blue with red and orange accents, representing its fiery nature. Despite its appearance, Volcanion is known for its peaceful demeanor. It is said that this Pokémon can generate powerful bursts of steam to protect itself and its allies.

Rowlet, the Grass Quill Pokémon. It is a dual-type Grass/Flying Pokémon. Rowlet is small and round, resembling a young owl. Its body is primarily brown with white accents. Rowlet possesses the ability to rotate its head up to 180 degrees, allowing it to see in all directions. It can also fly silently through the air, making it a skilled hunter. Despite its small size, Rowlet is a formidable opponent in battle.

Dartrix, the Blade Quill Pokémon and the evolved form of Rowlet. It remains a dual-type Grass/Flying Pokémon. Dartrix has a sleek and elegant appearance, with long feathers on its head that resemble a flowing mane. This Pokémon is highly agile and can maneuver swiftly through the air. Its feathers are sharp and can be launched like projectiles, making it a formidable opponent in battle. Dartrix is known for its keen intuition and intelligence.

Decidueye, the Arrow Quill Pokémon and the final evolved form of Rowlet. It retains its dual Grass/Ghost typing. Decidueye is a large and majestic Pokémon, resembling an owl archer. Its body is predominantly brown with accents of green and white. Decidueye possesses incredible marksmanship skills, using its wings as bowstrings to launch arrow-like feathers at its opponents with incredible precision. It is a silent and deadly hunter, striking its foes from the shadows.

Litten, the Fire Cat Pokémon. It is a Fire type Pokémon. Litten is small and quadrupedal, resembling a playful kitten. Its body is primarily black with red accents. Litten possesses the ability to produce and manipulate fire, using its flaming fur to intimidate enemies. It is known for its independent and self-reliant nature. Litten has sharp claws that can scratch and burn its opponents in battle. As it evolves, its fiery powers grow even stronger.

Torracat, the Fire Cat Pokémon and the evolved form of Litten. It is a Fire type. Torracat exhibits a muscular physique with sharp claws and ember-like fur on its body. This Pokémon is known for its agile and relentless nature in battle, capable of launching powerful fire attacks. As Torracat continues to evolve, its fighting instincts become even more honed.

Incineroar, the Heel Pokémon and the final evolved form of Litten. It remains a dual-type Fire/Dark Pokémon. Incineroar resembles a bulky feline with a fiery mane and belt-like appearance around its waist. It can manipulate flames to enhance its powerful physical attacks and is often seen showcasing its impressive wrestling skills in battle. Its intimidating presence and unparalleled strength make it a formidable opponent.

Popplio, the Sea Lion Pokémon and the starting form of the Water type Alola starter. Popplio has a vibrant blue body with a white ruff around its neck. It displays a playful and cheerful nature, often performing acrobatic tricks both on land and in water. This Pokémon can create balloons out of water, using them in battle to generate various water-based attacks as it evolves.

Brionne, the Pop Star Pokémon and the evolved form of Popplio. It remains a pure Water type. Brionne evolves from Popplio by performing graceful and rhythmic dances. This Pokémon has a talent for dancing and utilizes its melodious voice to perform captivating underwater shows. Brionne can emit balloons from its snout, giving it a range of different attacks that can be both stunning and powerful.

Primarina, the Soloist Pokémon and the final evolved form of Popplio. It is a Water/Fairy type. Primarina showcases an elegant and majestic appearance, resembling a mermaid with a flowing tail and a crown-like formation on its head. This Pokémon possesses a beautiful singing voice, which it uses to bewitch and charm its opponents in battle. Primarina's singing also has healing properties, making it an excellent support Pokémon.

Pikipek, the Woodpecker Pokémon. It is a Normal/Flying type. Pikipek is a small, bird-like Pokémon with vibrant plumage. Its beak is strong and sharp, allowing it to peck into trees to find food. Pikipek is known for its knack of drumming on trees with its beak, creating catchy rhythms that can be heard throughout the forest.

Trumbeak, the Bugle Beak Pokémon and the evolved form of Pikipek. It remains a dual-type Normal/Flying Pokémon. Trumbeak has a larger and more colorful beak than its previous form. It uses its bugle-like beak to resonate sound waves to communicate with its flock. Trumbeak has keen hearing and can detect even the faintest sounds from a distance.

Toucannon, the Cannon Pokémon and the final evolved form of Pikipek. It is a dual-type Normal/Flying Pokémon. Toucannon possesses a large beak with a vibrant coloration, resembling a cannon. This beak is highly powerful and precise, allowing Toucannon to launch seed bombs with incredible accuracy. It also uses its beak to mark its territory by drilling holes into trees.

Yungoos, the Loitering Pokémon. It is a Normal type. Yungoos is a small, mongoose-like Pokémon with a keen sense of smell. It constantly sniffs around, searching for food. Yungoos has a voracious appetite and will fiercely defend its territory when threatened. Its sharp teeth can take down prey much larger than itself.

Gumshoos, the Stakeout Pokémon and the evolved form of Yungoos. It remains a Normal type. Gumshoos is a larger and more menacing Pokémon than its previous form. With its sharp senses and strong jaw, Gumshoos is an excellent tracker and can locate its target from miles away. It is known for standing still and patiently waiting for hours to catch its prey off-guard.

Grubbin, the Larva Pokémon. It is a Bug type Pokémon discovered in the Alola region. Grubbin resembles a small insect larva with a yellow body and large mandibles. It thrives in dark areas and feeds on electricity, often burrowing into tree trunks to gather its energy. As it evolves, Grubbin transforms into a more powerful form.

Charjabug, the Battery Pokémon. It is an Electric/Bug type and the evolved form of Grubbin. Charjabug resembles a small, box-shaped creature with an electrical outlet. It stores the electricity it collects as a source of energy. Charjabug can often be found in nests made of rotting wood, where it gathers electricity from the environment.

Vikavolt, the Stag Beetle Pokémon. It is an Electric/Bug type and the final evolution of Grubbin. Vikavolt has a large metallic body resembling a stag beetle. It is known for its speed and powerful electrical attacks. Vikavolt harnesses electricity from the atmosphere and stores it in its large jaws, allowing it to release devastating lightning bolts.

Crabrawler, the Boxing Pokémon. It is a Fighting type Pokémon found in the Alola region. Crabrawler resembles a crab with purple coloring and boxing gloves on its front claws. It has a competitive nature and constantly seeks out opponents for battles. Crabrawler's punches are strong enough to break the shells of even the hardest coconuts.

Crabominable, the Woolly Crab Pokémon and the evolved form of Crabrawler. It remains a dual-type Fighting/Ice Pokémon. Crabominable has a massive crab-like body covered in shaggy white fur. Its icy claws are capable of freezing the surrounding air. Despite its large size, Crabominable is surprisingly agile and skilled in close-quarters combat.

Oricorio-Baile, the Dancing Pokémon. It is a Fire/Flying type and possesses a vibrant, red-colored body. Oricorio-Baile's unique feature is the Flamenco-style feathers on its head. This Pokémon is known for its graceful and mesmerizing dance moves, which it uses both for battle and to attract partners. When Oricorio-Baile dances, it gives off an intense heat, creating a fiery and captivating spectacle.

Cutiefly, the Bee Fly Pokémon. It is a Bug/Fairy type and resembles a small, delicate bee. Cutiefly has large, compound eyes that allow it to see in the dark and a sweet aroma that attracts nectar-seeking Pokémon. This Pokémon's wings are virtually translucent, and it flutters around flowers, spreading pollen as it goes. Cutiefly is often admired for its adorable appearance and gentle nature.

Ribombee, the Bee Fly Pokémon and the evolved form of Cutiefly. It remains a Bug/Fairy type. Ribombee retains its bee-like appearance, but now has a more refined and elegant form. Its small size is compensated by its incredibly fast flying speed. Ribombee is known for its furiously buzzing wings, which create a soothing hum. This Pokémon gathers nectar and pollen to create sweet and nutritious honey in its hive.

Rockruff, the Puppy Pokémon. It is a Rock type and resembles a cute puppy with a brown and black coat. Rockruff's ears are pointed and it has bright blue eyes that are full of curiosity. This Pokémon is known for its playful and energetic nature, always eager to explore its surroundings. Rockruff has an excellent sense of smell and can detect the presence of other Pokémon from far distances.

Lycanroc-Midday, the Wolf Pokémon and the midday form of Lycanroc. It is a Rock type and sports a golden coat with red markings. Lycanroc-Midday's appearance is reminiscent of a majestic wolf. This Pokémon is recognized for its sharp senses and impeccable hunting skills. Lycanroc-Midday is most active during the day and is agile in battle, using its strong limbs and razor-sharp claws to overpower opponents.

Wishiwashi-Solo, the Small Fry Pokémon. It is a Water type. Wishiwashi starts off as a tiny fish and prefers to live in schools for protection. However, when it feels threatened or weak, it can transform into its powerful School Form, becoming a large, intimidating fish capable of unleashing devastating attacks.

Mareanie, the Brutal Star Pokémon. It is a Poison/Water type. Mareanie is a small, blue and purple Pokémon with sharp spikes on its body. It disguises itself as a crown of coral to attract prey, and then attacks by injecting venom with its tentacles. It evolves when it reaches a certain level of affection with its trainer.

Toxapex, the Brutal Star Pokémon and the evolved form of Mareanie. It remains a dual-type Poison/Water Pokémon. Toxapex is a large, purple and blue Pokémon with a spiked, poisonous body. It is known for its vicious nature and its ability to poison its enemies with its tentacles. Toxapex is highly territorial and will aggressively defend its territory.

Mudbray, the Donkey Pokémon. It is a Ground type. Mudbray is a small, donkey-like Pokémon with a brown body and a muddy mane. It is known for its strong and sturdy build, which allows it to carry heavy loads. Mudbray is also known for its stubbornness and determination, never giving up even in the face of adversity.

Mudsdale, the Draft Horse Pokémon and the evolved form of Mudbray. It remains a Ground type. Mudsdale is a large, powerful Pokémon with a black and brown body and a strong, muscular build. It is revered for its incredible strength and endurance, and it is often used as a draft Pokémon in heavy construction and farming tasks.

Dewpider, the Water Bubble Pokémon. It is a Water/Bug type. Dewpider is a small, blue spider-like Pokémon that lives both on land and in water. It creates a bubble of water that it carries on its back, which allows it to breathe and move freely underwater. Dewpider is known for its expert web-spinning skills and can catch its prey by ensnaring them in sticky webs.

Araquanid, the Water Bubble Pokémon and the evolved form of Dewpider. It remains a dual-type Water/Bug Pokémon. Araquanid has a larger and more intimidating appearance than its previous form, with a giant water bubble on its back. It uses this bubble to create powerful water attacks, shooting jets of water at its opponents with great precision. Araquanid is highly territorial and will fiercely protect its nest from any perceived threats.

Fomantis, the Sickle Grass Pokémon. It is a Grass type. Fomantis resembles a small plant with bright green leaves and a flower on its head. It spends most of its time basking in the sunlight to gather energy for its evolution. Fomantis is a timid Pokémon that avoids confrontation, using its leafy stalks to camouflage itself among foliage. It will only attack when it feels threatened or if its territory is invaded.

Lurantis, the Bloom Sickle Pokémon and the evolved form of Fomantis. It remains a Grass type. Lurantis is a large, graceful Pokémon with vibrant pink and green coloring. It has long, blade-like limbs that it uses to deliver swift and precise strikes on its opponents. Lurantis possesses the ability to emit a sweet aroma from its petals, which attracts prey and also has a calming effect on other Pokémon.

Morelull, the Illuminating Pokémon. It is a Grass/Fairy type. Morelull has a round, mushroom-like body with glowing spores on its head. These spores have a calming effect on those who inhale them, making Morelull a popular choice for aromatherapy. Morelull is most active during the night, using its glowing spores to light up dark areas. It often forms groups and dances together, creating a mesmerizing sight.

Shiinotic, the Mushroom Pokémon. It is a Grass/Fairy type. Shiinotic has a distinct appearance, with its large mushroom cap and glowing spores. It emits a soothing aroma that lulls nearby creatures to sleep. This Pokémon is known for its harmonious dances, performed to attract spores and create a vibrant and mesmerizing spectacle.

Salandit, the Toxic Lizard Pokémon. It is a Poison/Fire type. Salandit is a small, reptilian Pokémon with a venomous tail and a unique ability to release toxic fumes. Female Salandit possess the ability to emit pheromones that can attract and control males of any species. It is important to handle this Pokémon with caution, as its toxins can cause severe burns.

Salazzle, the Toxic Lizard Pokémon and the evolved form of Salandit. It remains a dual-type Poison/Fire Pokémon. Salazzle is a sleek and elegant Pokémon, known for its powerful flames and venomous attacks. Female Salazzle are particularly vicious, using their captivating beauty to lure unsuspecting prey. Salazzle's toxins are potent enough to melt even the toughest metal.

Stufful, the Flailing Pokémon. It is a Normal/Fighting type. Despite its cute and cuddly appearance, Stufful possesses incredible strength. It may unintentionally harm others due to its playful nature. This Pokémon is often seen hugging its own body in an attempt to suppress its powerful flailing. Stufful has a strong desire for affection and seeks out companionship.

Bewear, the Strong Arm Pokémon and the evolved form of Stufful. It remains a dual-type Normal/Fighting Pokémon. Bewear is an immensely strong and protective Pokémon. Its strong, paws can easily break trees and crush rocks. Bewear's hugs, while well-intentioned, can unintentionally cause serious injuries due to its immense strength. This Pokémon is fiercely loyal to those it considers part of its family.

Bounsweet, the Fruit Pokémon. It is a Grass type. Bounsweet is known for its sweet scent and the colorful fruit that grows on its head. Despite its cute appearance, it has thorns hidden beneath its leaves, which it can use to defend itself from predators. This Pokémon is often found in warm tropical areas.

Steenee, the Fruit Pokémon and the evolved form of Bounsweet. It remains a Grass type. Steenee is known for its agile and graceful movements, resembling a dancer. It is filled with boundless energy, always looking for opportunities to show off its dance skills. Its highly evolved sense of hearing helps it to detect the faintest sounds.

Tsareena, the Fruit Pokémon and the evolved form of Steenee. It remains a Grass type. Tsareena is the queen of the jungle, known for its elegance and confidence. Its powerful kicks can cause severe damage, demonstrating its strength and authority. Tsareena emits a pleasant fragrance which can calm those around it.

Comfey, the Posy Picker Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Comfey is known for its small and delicate appearance, resembling a bouquet of flowers. It collects flowers and hangs them around its neck to create a soothing aroma. This Pokémon has the ability to heal others by weaving the flowers into wreaths.

Oranguru, the Sage Pokémon. It is a Normal/Psychic type. Oranguru is known for its wisdom and knowledge, spending most of its time deep in the forests. It is an excellent observer and often seen meditating. Oranguru possesses a fan-like organ on its head, which it uses to communicate with others and share its wisdom.

Passimian, the Teamwork Pokémon. It is a pure Fighting type. Passimian is known for its incredible team coordination skills. It lives in troops and is always looking out for its teammates. Passimian has a strong throwing arm, allowing it to throw objects with amazing accuracy and power. It takes great pride in its ability to work together with others to achieve victory.

Wimpod, the Turn Tail Pokémon. It is a Bug/Water type. Wimpod is extremely timid and easily frightened. It has a strong aversion to danger and will often flee from any threatening situation. When confronted, Wimpod will use its incredible speed and agility to escape by running away or diving into the ocean. Despite its timid nature, Wimpod has sharp survival instincts that help it avoid danger.

Golisopod, the Hard Scale Pokémon and the evolved form of Wimpod. It is a Bug/Water type. Golisopod is a formidable fighter known for its powerful claws and armored exoskeleton. It uses its claws to deliver devastating blows to opponents. Golisopod is an incredibly skilled strategist, always analyzing its opponent's weaknesses and planning its attacks accordingly. It is also fiercely protective of its territory and will defend it at all costs.

Sandygast, the Sand Heap Pokémon. It is a Ghost/Ground type. Sandygast is formed when grudges of the deceased gather in a pile of sand. It has the ability to control the sand it is made of, shaping it into various forms. Sandygast is known to lure unsuspecting prey by disguising itself as a harmless sand mound. It then attacks with its powerful sand-based moves, trapping its victims within its sandy body.

Palossand, the Sand Castle Pokémon and the evolved form of Sandygast. It remains a Ghost/Ground type. Palossand is an imposing figure, resembling a massive sand castle. It has the ability to create terrifying illusions, causing anyone who approaches it to become lost in a mirage. Palossand is also known for its powerful sandstorms, which it can create to bury unsuspecting enemies. It absorbs the life force of those it traps in its sandy vortex, growing stronger with each victim.

Pyukumuku, the Sea Cucumber Pokémon. It is a pure Water type. Pyukumuku has a soft, cylindrical body with a round, pinkish face. It lives on rocky shores and uses its sticky, gooey innards to attach itself to rocks or other surfaces. Pyukumuku has limited movement capabilities and relies on the tides to bring it food and carry away waste.

Type: Null, the Synthetic Pokémon. It is a Normal type. Type: Null is a creature engineered for battle, with a unique helmet-like mask that restrains its latent powers. It possesses incredible strength and agility, making it a formidable opponent. This Pokémon's true power awakens once it evolves into its ultimate form.

Silvally, the Synthetic Pokémon and the evolved form of Type: Null. It is a Normal type. Silvally is a mythical creature with a sleek, wolf-like appearance and a helmet-like mask similar to its pre-evolution. It can change its type based on the memory disc it holds, allowing it to adapt to different situations and become a versatile battler.

Minior, the Meteor Pokémon. It is a dual-type Rock/Flying Pokémon. Minior has a spherical body protected by a hard outer shell. When its shell cracks, it reveals a vibrant, core body. Minior comes in different colors depending on the environment it's born in. The red meteor form represents the intense heat of the environment it hatched in.

Komala, the Drowsing Pokémon. It is a pure Normal type. Komala appears as a small, round, and fluffy creature that is always asleep. It clings to a log, acting as both a bed and a shield. Komala rarely wakes up, even during battles, and attacks by flinging itself at opponents using the momentum from its log. Its log is sacred and should never be touched.

Turtonator, the Blast Pokémon. It is a Fire/Dragon type. Turtonator has a heavily armored shell that protects it from physical attacks. It uses its explosive flames to deter anyone who tries to get too close. This Pokémon is known to fiercely guard its territory and can unleash devastating fire-based attacks, making it a fearsome opponent.

Togedemaru, the Roly-Poly Pokémon. It is an Electric/Steel type. Togedemaru is covered in sharp needle-like spines, which it can use to defend itself from predators. When threatened, it can curl up into a spiky ball and roll away at high speed. Togedemaru's cheeks also store electricity, and it can release this energy as powerful electric attacks.

Mimikyu, the Disguise Pokémon. It is a Ghost/Fairy type. Mimikyu is a mysterious Pokémon that always wears a Pikachu-inspired disguise to avoid being noticed. Its true appearance is said to be so hideous that it can cause anyone who sees it to suffer from a mysterious illness. Mimikyu is very protective of its disguise and will fiercely defend it.

Bruxish, the Gnash Teeth Pokémon. It is a Water/Psychic type. Bruxish has a unique appearance with vivid colors and sharp fangs. It uses its powerful jaws to crush the shells of its prey, which it can detect using its highly developed sixth sense. Bruxish's brightly colored body can also emit an unsettling psychic energy that disorients and confuses its opponents.

Drampa, the Placid Pokémon. It is a Normal/Dragon type. Drampa is a gentle and wise Pokémon that resides in the mountains. It has a long neck and a kind face, which makes it appear like a wise elder. Despite its calm demeanor, Drampa can unleash powerful Dragon-type attacks when provoked. It is also known to be protective of children and will go to great lengths to ensure their safety.

Dhelmise, the Sea Creeper Pokémon. It is a dual-type Ghost/Grass Pokémon. Dhelmise resembles an anchor with a haunting presence. While it may appear to be inanimate, it actually relies on seaweed as its life force. Dhelmise floats through the ocean, capturing passing prey with its anchor chains. Legends say that this Pokémon's wrath is unleashed when its seaweed is disturbed.

Jangmo-o, the Scaly Pokémon. It is a Dragon type. Jangmo-o is a small, reptilian Pokémon with resilient scales that protect its body. This Pokémon trains diligently to someday grow stronger and become a powerful dragon. Jangmo-o's willpower is unwavering, and it is known to never give up in the face of adversity. It is often seen practicing its fighting techniques.

Hakamo-o, the Scaly Pokémon and the evolved form of Jangmo-o. It remains a Dragon type. Hakamo-o retains its reptilian appearance but has grown larger and stronger. It constantly seeks battles in order to gain more experience and continue its growth. The scales covering its body can become very sharp and are used as weapons. Hakamo-o has a strong sense of pride and will always defend its territory.

Kommo-o, the Scaly Pokémon and the final evolved form of Jangmo-o. It continues to be a Dragon type. Kommo-o is an intimidating and majestic Pokémon with a warrior-like presence. The scales on its body have become extremely hard, granting it powerful defense. It performs a unique dance during battles called the Clanging Scales, unleashing a barrage of damaging strikes and damaging its own scales in the process.

Tapu Koko, the Land Spirit Pokémon. It is an Electric/Fairy type. Tapu Koko is an energetic and mischievous Pokémon known for its lightning-fast speed. It possesses the ability to fly using the special feathers on its back. Tapu Koko is the guardian deity of Melemele Island and protects the land and its inhabitants. It can create thunderstorms and deliver powerful electric attacks to defend its territory.

Tapu Lele, the Land Spirit Pokémon. It is a Psychic/Fairy type. Tapu Lele has a vibrant pink and purple body with a shell-like headpiece. It is known for its ability to create small orbs of psychic energy that it scatters around to create a calming atmosphere. Tapu Lele is deeply connected with the land and is a guardian of the Alola region.

Tapu Bulu, the Land Spirit Pokémon. It is a Grass/Fairy type. Tapu Bulu has a strong and sturdy body, resembling a bull. It possesses a large, shield-like horn on its head and a grassy mane that can create dense forests. Tapu Bulu is seen as a protector of nature and uses its immense strength to maintain balance within its domain.

Tapu Fini, the Land Spirit Pokémon. It is a Water/Fairy type. Tapu Fini has a graceful and ethereal appearance with a blue and white body resembling a mermaid. It envelops itself in a veil of mist, creating an aura of mystery. Tapu Fini has the ability to purify any contaminated water and is often revered as a deity of healing and purity.

Cosmog, the Nebula Pokémon. It is a Psychic type. Cosmog is a small and fragile Pokémon that is almost always found floating in the air. It has a curious and innocent nature, often found staring up at the stars. Cosmog is said to be a newborn star that will eventually evolve into a powerful legendary Pokémon.

Cosmoem, the Protostar Pokémon. It is a Psychic type. Cosmoem resembles a celestial cocoon with a dark body and star-like patterns. It spends most of its time motionless, absorbing vast amounts of cosmic energy. Cosmoem's body is believed to contain the potential to birth a new universe, making it a highly sought-after Pokémon.

Solgaleo, the Sunne Pokémon. It is a Psychic/Steel type. Solgaleo resembles a majestic lion, with a golden metallic mane and a dominant presence. It is said to be able to command the sun itself, radiating powerful solar energy from its body. Solgaleo's strong connection to the sun allows it to charge its attacks with intense heat and light.

Lunala, the Moone Pokémon. It is a Psychic/Ghost type. Lunala has a mesmerizing appearance, resembling a large bat with flowing wings and a crescent moon-shaped body. It is a mysterious and nocturnal Pokémon, known to traverse the night sky and create moonlight wherever it goes. Lunala possesses the ability to absorb light and store it as energy.

Nihilego, the UB-01 Pokémon. It is a Rock/Poison type. Nihilego has an ethereal and otherworldly form, consisting of a body composed of crystalline structures. It is an Ultra Beast known for its invasive and parasitic nature. Nihilego emits a neurotoxin that affects the minds of those who come into contact with it, drawing them under its control.

Buzzwole, the Swollen Pokémon. It is a Bug/Fighting type. Buzzwole possesses a highly muscular and imposing physique, resembling a humanoid insect. Its arms are massively developed and can produce incredible strength. Buzzwole feeds on the energy of its opponents by draining their blood, which grants it immense power and size.

Pheromosa, the Lissome Pokémon. It is a Bug/Fighting type. Pheromosa has an incredibly slender and elegant figure, making it one of the fastest Pokémon in existence. Its movements are graceful, almost like a dance, allowing it to outmaneuver opponents with ease. Pheromosa's body produces a captivating pheromone that can attract and mesmerize other Pokémon.

Xurkitree, the Glowing Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Xurkitree has a unique and striking appearance, with a tall, slender body made entirely of bright yellow electricity. It emits a powerful electrical aura, which can sometimes cause nearby electronic devices to malfunction. Xurkitree is known for its high Special Attack stat and its ability to learn a wide variety of Electric-type moves.

Celesteela, the Launch Pokémon. It is a Steel/Flying type. Celesteela resembles a robotic creature with an elongated body, resembling a spaceship or rocket. Its steel body is incredibly durable, allowing it to withstand extreme pressures and temperatures. Despite its heavy appearance, Celesteela is surprisingly agile in the air and can reach incredible speeds. It is also known for its signature move, 'Beak Blast', which releases a powerful blast of flames.

Kartana, the Drawn Sword Pokémon. It is a Grass/Steel type. Kartana is one of the Ultra Beasts and has a unique appearance resembling a small, folded origami-like creature. Despite its small size, Kartana possesses incredible cutting powers, capable of slicing through even the toughest materials with ease. Its body is made up of thin, razor-sharp leaves that can ignite into intense flames when exposed to sunlight.

Guzzlord, the Junkivore Pokémon. It is a Dark/Dragon type. Guzzlord is a massive and gluttonous Pokémon that constantly devours everything in its path. It has an insatiable appetite and can consume virtually anything, including buildings and even mountains. Its large mouth is filled with sharp teeth, which can tear through any material. Guzzlord's presence instills fear in those who encounter it, as it is an incredibly destructive force.

Necrozma, the Prism Pokémon. It is a Psychic type. Necrozma is a mysterious and enigmatic Pokémon that possesses incredible psychic powers. Its body is covered in multi-colored crystals, which emit a dazzling light when it uses its powerful attacks. Necrozma has the ability to absorb light energy, which it uses to enhance its own strength and unleash devastating attacks. Its true power is revealed when it undergoes a transformation, becoming either Dusk Mane Necrozma or Dawn Wings Necrozma.

Magearna, the Artificial Pokémon. It is a Steel/Fairy type. Magearna has a metallic body with a pinkish hue, adorned with intricate designs. Created centuries ago, it possesses a soul within its body, allowing it to experience emotions. Magearna's ability to understand and empathize with humans has made it a valuable companion throughout the ages.

Marshadow, the Gloomdweller Pokémon. It is a Fighting/Ghost type. Marshadow appears as a small black shadow with glowing yellow eyes. It is known for its elusive nature, rarely being seen by humans. Marshadow possesses incredible speed and agility, allowing it to swiftly move through shadows. Legends say that it can merge with the shadows of others and copy their movements and techniques.

Poipole, the Poison Pin Pokémon. It is a Poison type. Poipole is a small, purple, quadrupedal creature with a long neck and tail. It has the ability to emit a toxic liquid from its tentacle-like appendages. This venom not only serves as a means of defense but can also be used to incapacitate prey. Despite its small size, Poipole displays remarkable intelligence and adaptability.

Naganadel, the Poison Flying Pokémon and the evolved form of Poipole. It remains a dual-type Poison/Dragon Pokémon. Naganadel resembles a sleek, purple dragon with elongated wings and a slender body. It possesses the ability to fly at incredible speeds, darting through the skies effortlessly. Naganadel's venom is more potent than ever, capable of inflicting severe damage to even the sturdiest of opponents.

Stakataka, the Rampart Pokémon. It is a Rock/Steel type. Stakataka is a massive, towering structure composed of geometric blocks. Its body is incredibly dense, allowing it to withstand devastating blows. Stakataka has a stoic and unyielding demeanor, defending its territory fiercely. Legends speak of its ability to absorb energy from its surroundings, reinforcing its already formidable defenses.

Blacephalon, the Fireworks Pokémon. It is a Fire/Ghost type. Blacephalon has a slender body with a primarily white coloration and bursts of vibrant orange and purple. This Pokémon has a captivatingly playful nature, often amusing itself by juggling explosive fireballs formed from its own head. Despite its mischievous behavior, Blacephalon is highly intelligent and possesses exceptional speed and agility.

Zeraora, the Thunderclap Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Zeraora possesses a sleek and feline-like appearance. Its fur is predominantly yellow with black stripes, and it has large, expressive blue eyes. This Pokémon's electrical powers allow it to create strong electric currents and move at incredible speeds. Zeraora is known for its fierce loyalty and protective nature toward its allies.

Meltan, the Hex Nut Pokémon. It is a Steel type. Meltan resembles a small, metallic blob with a nut-shaped head. Its body is mostly composed of liquid metal, allowing it to stretch and change shape at will. Meltan possesses a curious and mischievous nature, often drawn to metallic objects. It has the unique ability to generate electricity from its metallic body.

Melmetal, the Hex Nut Pokémon and the evolved form of Meltan. It remains a Steel type. Melmetal is a colossal Pokémon with a body made entirely of liquid metal. Its sheer size and immense strength render it fearsome in battle. Melmetal's flexible arms can stretch to great lengths, enabling it to deliver devastating punches with incredible force. Despite its imposing appearance, Melmetal is gentle and protective of its Trainer.

Grookey, the Chimp Pokémon. It is a Grass type and one of the three starter Pokémon of the Galar region. Grookey has a small, green monkey-like body with a long tail. It is adorned with a leafy crown on top of its head. This Pokémon is known for its energetic and playful nature, often using its wooden stick as a drumstick to create rhythmic beats. Grookey can generate powerful vibrations through its drumming, which have revitalizing effects on plants and other Pokémon.

Thwackey, the Beat Pokémon and the evolved form of Scorbunny. It is a dual-type Grass Pokémon. Thwackey is known for its energetic and playful nature. This Pokémon wields a large drumstick as a weapon, which it uses to create rhythmic beats. Thwackey's drumming can communicate its emotions and intentions to others of its kind.

Rillaboom, the Drummer Pokémon and the final evolved form of Scorbunny. It remains a dual-type Grass Pokémon. Rillaboom is the master of its drumming skills, able to produce powerful and captivating rhythm that can be heard from miles away. This Pokémon's beating can command the attention of other Pokémon and even calm raging battles.

Scorbunny, the Rabbit Pokémon, is a Fire type. Scorbunny is known for its swift speed, agility, and fiery spirit. It has powerful legs that allow it to jump incredibly high and cover long distances. This Pokémon's fur is warm and fluffy, and a small blaze can often be seen burning at the tip of its tail.

Raboot, the Rabbit Pokémon and the evolved form of Scorbunny. It remains a Fire type. Raboot has matured since its previous form and has gained a more serious and focused demeanor. This Pokémon possesses remarkable speed and specializes in agile movements to outmaneuver its opponents. Raboot's fur is sleek and its flames burn brighter.

Cinderace, the Striker Pokémon and the final evolved form of Scorbunny. It is a Fire type. Cinderace excels in agility and possesses extraordinary dexterity with its feet. This Pokémon is widely known for its exceptional soccer skills, capable of delivering precise and powerful kicks. Cinderace can also manipulate the flames on its body to enhance its movements and attacks.

Sobble is the Water type Pokémon. It is a small, timid creature that prefers to blend into its surroundings. Its blue body and big eyes allow it to blend seamlessly with water, making it nearly invisible. Sobble becomes easily overwhelmed and can release tears as a defense mechanism.

Drizzile is the evolved form of Sobble. This Water type Pokémon has developed a mischievous and confident personality. With its blue scales and sleek body, it can move effortlessly through water. Drizzile is known for its ability to produce water balloons from its fingertips and launch them with precision.

Inteleon is the final evolution of Sobble. This Water type Pokémon possesses a sleek and agile body, allowing for quick and precise movements. Inteleon's long tail acts as a sniper rifle, capable of launching a super high-powered water bullet with extreme accuracy. It is known for its cool and calculating nature.

Skwovet is the Cheeky Pokémon and a Normal type. It is a small and plump creature that loves to eat and gather food. Skwovet has a grayish-brown body with large, adorable eyes. It is notorious for stealing food from people's bags and foraging for berries. Despite its size, Skwovet can be surprisingly agile when it comes to escaping danger.

Greedent is the evolved form of Skwovet. This Normal type Pokémon is larger and has a rounder body compared to its pre-evolution. Greedent is always on the hunt for more food and is known for its insatiable appetite. It has prominent front teeth that can chew through solid wood. Greedent is territorial and fiercely protects its food stash.

Rookidee, the Tiny Raven Pokémon. It is a Flying type. Rookidee is a small bird Pokémon with black feathers and a pointed beak. Known for its agility, Rookidee can swiftly navigate through the air and change directions effortlessly. Although it may seem weak at first, Rookidee possesses great potential to evolve into a formidable flyer.

Corvisquire, the Raven Pokémon and the evolved form of Rookidee. It remains a Flying type. Corvisquire has a sleek body covered in black feathers. Its wings provide excellent speed and maneuverability, allowing it to fly gracefully in the sky. Corvisquire is known to be an intelligent Pokémon that is fiercely loyal to its Trainer.

Corviknight, the Raven Pokémon and the final evolved form of Rookidee. It is a dual-type Flying/Steel Pokémon. Corviknight is a large and majestic bird known for its impressive wingspan. Its steel-plated feathers provide incredible durability and protection. Corviknight is highly territorial, guarding its Trainer with unwavering loyalty.

Blipbug, the Larva Pokémon. It is a Bug type. Blipbug is a small bug Pokémon with a blue body and round eyes. Its simple appearance hides a complex brain that allows it to crunch data and solve problems quickly. Blipbug communicates with others of its kind by using flashing lights on its antennae.

Dottler, the Radome Pokémon and the evolved form of Blipbug. It is a dual-type Bug/Psychic Pokémon. Dottler has a round body covered in a protective shell. Its shell acts as a radar, allowing it to sense its surroundings with precision. Dottler possesses strong psychic powers and can manipulate objects using telekinesis.

Orbeetle, the Seven Spot Pokémon. It is a Bug/Psychic type. Orbeetle resembles a large beetle with a round, UFO-like body. It has a shining yellow shell with seven black spots and glowing blue eyes. This Pokémon has incredible psychic abilities, which it uses to levitate and create powerful psychic pulses to defend itself. Orbeetle is known for its intelligence and strategic thinking.

Nickit, the Fox Pokémon. It is a Dark type. Nickit is a small quadrupedal creature that resembles a fox. It has sleek, dark fur with white markings around its eyes and tail. Nickit is highly skilled at sneaking and stealing, using its cunning nature to survive in urban areas. It is known to be mischievous and crafty, often outsmarting its opponents with its quick thinking.

Thievul, the Fox Pokémon and the evolved form of Nickit. It remains a Dark type. Thievul is a sly and cunning Pokémon that resembles an elegant fox. It has a slender body with a purple coat, white eyebrows, and a triangular white marking on its forehead. Thievul is known for its exceptional intelligence and abilities in deception. It uses its long, bushy tail to confuse and distract its opponents while stealing their belongings.

Gossifleur, the Flowering Pokémon. It is a Grass type. Gossifleur is a small, plant-like creature with a round body and tiny limbs. It has light green leaves on its head, resembling a blooming flower. Gossifleur is known for its delicate nature and its ability to spread pollen and seeds in the wind. This Pokémon floats gracefully in the breeze, collecting sunlight to nourish itself and promote the growth of its future offspring.

Eldegoss, the Cotton Bloom Pokémon and the evolved form of Gossifleur. It remains a Grass type. Eldegoss is a large, dandelion-like Pokémon with a cotton-like fluff covering its body. It has a bright yellow head with pointed petals, resembling a blooming flower. Eldegoss is known for its ability to generate cotton fluff with healing properties. This Pokémon spreads its fluffy seeds in the wind, bringing hope and good fortune to those who encounter them.

Wooloo, the Sheep Pokémon. It is a Normal type Pokémon. Wooloo is covered in fluffy white wool that keeps it warm in all kinds of weather. This Pokémon tends to avoid battle and instead use its wool as a defense mechanism. When threatened, Wooloo will curl up and roll away to escape its adversaries.

Dubwool, the Sheep Pokémon and the evolved form of Wooloo. It remains a dual-type Normal Pokémon. Dubwool's wool continues to grow, now forming thick dreadlocks. Its defensive wool is impressively durable, capable of withstanding most attacks. Despite its gentle nature, Dubwool uses its powerful horns to defend itself and its companions.

Chewtle, the Snapping Pokémon. It is a Water type Pokémon. Chewtle is a small turtle-like Pokémon with a tough jaw and strong teeth. It loves to bite onto objects and has a habit of chomping on anything it can find. Chewtle's powerful jaws and sharp teeth make it a formidable opponent in battles.

Drednaw, the Bite Pokémon and the evolved form of Chewtle. It is a dual-type Water/Rock Pokémon. Drednaw is a massive creature with a rugged shell that resembles a mountain. Its jaw is incredibly powerful, capable of tearing through steel. Drednaw's rocky shell provides excellent defense, making it nearly impervious to all attacks.

Yamper, the Puppy Pokémon. It is an Electric type Pokémon. With its adorable appearance and playful nature, Yamper quickly becomes a favorite among trainers. It has a special organ in its body that generates electricity, allowing it to collect static electricity from the air. Yamper's heart-shaped tail wags energetically and can even serve as a power source for small devices.

Boltund, the Dog Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Boltund resembles a large, energetic dog with a sleek, black and yellow-striped coat. It has a prominent blue crest on its forehead that is charged with electricity, allowing it to generate powerful electric attacks. Known for its speed and agility, Boltund is a loyal and playful companion.

Rolycoly, the Coal Pokémon. It is a Rock type. Rolycoly is a small, round Pokémon resembling a lump of coal. It has an orange ember burning inside its body, which provides the energy needed for its locomotion. Despite its small size, Rolycoly is known for its incredible strength and durability. It is often found in caves or around mines.

Carkol, the Coal Pokémon and the evolved form of Rolycoly. It remains a Rock type. Carkol is larger and more robust than its previous form. Its body is now predominantly black with orange accents, and it has a furnace-like structure on its back that emits strong heat. Carkol is an adept digger and can travel through underground tunnels with ease.

Coalossal, the Coal Pokémon and the final evolved form of Rolycoly. It retains its Rock type. Coalossal is a massive creature made entirely of coal, with large orange cracks running through its body. Its internal fire burns hotter than ever, allowing it to unleash devastating attacks. Known for its impressive strength and endurance, Coalossal can be found in mountainous regions.

Applin, the Apple Core Pokémon. It is a Grass/Dragon type. Applin resembles a small worm-like creature with a green apple for its head. Its body is usually hidden inside the apple, providing protection. Applin is often seen in orchards and forests, where it feeds on the nutrients within the apple. When it evolves, the apple becomes the main body of the Pokémon.

Flapple, the Apple Wing Pokémon. It is a dual-type Grass/Dragon Pokémon. Flapple resembles a dragon with its vibrant green body, emphasized by a large apple-shaped head. This Pokémon is known for its ability to launch its sweet-smelling apples at high speeds, often catching opponents off guard. Flapple also has the capability to release a powerful Dragon-type move called Dragon Darts.

Appletun, the Apple Nectar Pokémon. It is a dual-type Grass/Dragon Pokémon. Appletun has a round and plump body with a pale yellow color. The flaps on its head resemble a delectable apple pie. This Pokémon is known for its love for sweet nectar, which it produces by fermenting berries in its body. Appletun's signature move is the Dragon-type attack called Apple Acid.

Silicobra, the Sand Snake Pokémon. It is a Ground type Pokémon. Silicobra possesses a sandy beige colored body with a distinctive, coiled tail. This Pokémon is often found in arid environments, living beneath the surface and leaving distinctive patterns in the sand. Silicobra has the ability to regenerate lost body parts and can launch sand from its mouth to blind opponents.

Sandaconda, the Sand Snake Pokémon and the evolved form of Silicobra. It remains a Ground type Pokémon. Sandaconda boasts a larger and more imposing stature than its pre-evolved form, with a tan-colored body and formidable spiky scales. This Pokémon can move effortlessly through sand, and it can engulf its prey by creating quicksand with the vibrations of its body.

Cramorant, the Gulp Pokémon. It is a dual-type Flying/Water Pokémon. Cramorant has a hefty body and a long neck, with blue feathers covering its head and wings. This Pokémon is known for its voracious appetite, often catching fish and small Pokémon by diving into bodies of water. Cramorant's unique ability allows it to swallow its prey whole and then shoot it out as powerful projectiles during battle.

Arrokuda, the Rushing Pokémon. It is a Water type. Arrokuda is a small, fierce-looking fish with a sharp and elongated body. Its powerful jaws and agility make it an expert swimmer, allowing it to swiftly chase down its prey. This Pokémon is known for its relentless pursuit and lightning-fast attacks.

Barraskewda, the Skewer Pokémon and the evolved form of Arrokuda. It remains a pure Water type. Barraskewda is a formidable predator, renowned for its incredible speed and sharp, needle-like teeth. Its streamlined body and muscular tail enable it to reach incredible swimming speeds, making it a fearsome hunter in the water.

Toxel, the Baby Pokémon. It is an Electric/Poison type. Toxel is a small, cute creature with a unique body shape and short limbs. Despite its innocent appearance, Toxel has the ability to generate and store electricity within its body. It may release electric shocks when it is excited or startled.

Toxtricity (Amped Form), the Punk Pokémon and the evolved form of Toxel. It is an Electric/Poison type. Toxtricity is a rebellious and energetic Pokémon, known for its rowdy behavior. Its body is covered in bright orange and yellow markings, emphasizing its wild personality. Toxtricity can create powerful sound waves by vibrating the bumps on its body, which can cause paralysis or disorient opponents.

Sizzlipede, the Radiator Pokémon. It is a Bug/Fire type. Sizzlipede is a small arthropod with a segmented body covered in a protective exoskeleton. It has a burning red-hot body that can reach extremely high temperatures. Sizzlipede's body heat acts as a defense mechanism, discouraging potential predators from attacking. It can also emit scorching flames from its back, consuming anything in its path.

Centiskorch, the Radiator Pokémon, is a Bug/Fire type. It has a long, fiery body that resembles a centipede and is covered in bright orange and yellow flames. Centiskorch's flames are so hot that they can reach temperatures of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. This Pokémon uses its fiery body to cook its prey before consuming it.

Clobbopus, the Tantrum Pokémon, is a Fighting type. It is a small, pink octopus-like Pokémon with strong arms. Clobbopus is known for its playful and energetic nature, often engaging in friendly sparring matches with other Pokémon and trainers. When it gets excited, it starts flapping its tentacles rapidly.

Grapploct, the Jujitsu Pokémon, is a Fighting type and the evolved form of Clobbopus. It has a muscular physique and six powerful tentacles that it uses to grapple and immobilize opponents. Grapploct is a master of jujitsu, a martial art that focuses on throws, locks, and holds. It can effortlessly take down opponents much larger than itself.

Sinistea, the Black Tea Pokémon, is a Ghost type. It resembles a small, elegant teacup and is usually found in antique teapots. Sinistea is said to be created when a spirit possesses a cold cup of tea. It is a mischievous Pokémon known for its ability to trick and confuse others. It often disguises itself as a normal cup of tea to deceive unsuspecting trainers and Pokémon.

Polteageist, the Black Tea Pokémon, is a Ghost type and the evolved form of Sinistea. It retains the appearance of a small teapot but gains a more teapot-like body shape and a sinister expression. Polteageist is a mischievous and playful Pokémon that loves to serve tea to those it considers friends. It can pour tea endlessly without running out, using its ghostly powers to generate an infinite supply of delicious tea.

Hatenna, the Calm Pokémon. It is a Psychic type. Hatenna's body is covered in pink fur and it has a large, round head with two downturned, floppy ears. This Pokémon has the ability to sense the emotions of others and uses its psychic powers to soothe and heal those in distress. Hatenna's psychic abilities become stronger as it evolves.

Hattrem, the Serene Pokémon and the evolved form of Hatenna. It remains a Psychic type. Hattrem's fur becomes longer and its head grows larger, with its floppy ears now standing upright. This Pokémon possesses powerful psychic powers which it uses both for defensive and offensive purposes. Hattrem emits a calming aura that brings peace to those around it.

Hatterene, the Silent Pokémon and the final evolved form of Hatenna. It is a dual-type Psychic/Fairy Pokémon. Hatterene's appearance becomes more elegant and mystical, with longer hair and a gown-like body. This Pokémon has the ability to generate soundless psychic waves that can bend spoons and even cause its opponents to become immobilized. Hatterene often hides in the shadows, observing the emotions of others.

Impidimp, the Mischievous Pokémon. It is a Dark/Fairy type. Impidimp has a small, impish body with purple fur and a mischievous grin. This Pokémon enjoys causing pranks and mischief, often playing tricks on unsuspecting victims. Despite its mischievous nature, Impidimp is loyal to those who earn its trust, and it can be a valuable ally in battle.

Morgrem, the Devious Pokémon and the evolved form of Impidimp. It remains a Dark/Fairy type. Morgrem is slightly larger and more intimidating than its previous form, with sharp claws and a mischievous expression. This Pokémon is known for its sneaky nature and cunning tactics. Morgrem is skilled at using illusions and trickery to confuse and distract its opponents in battle.

Grimmsnarl, the bulked-up Pokémon. It is a Dark/Fairy type. Grimmsnarl is known for its towering height and muscular build. Its body is covered in long, shaggy fur that gives it a wild and intimidating appearance. With its powerful arms, Grimmsnarl can easily crush opponents. It is said to be mischievous and enjoys playing pranks on unsuspecting victims.

Obstagoon, the Blocking Pokémon. It is a Dark/Normal type. Obstagoon is characterized by its upright stance and aggressive posture. Its reddish-black fur, combined with its sharp claws and teeth, make it a formidable opponent. Obstagoon is known to be fiercely protective of its territory, using its sharp senses to sense any potential threats.

Perrserker, the Viking Pokémon. It is a Steel type. Perrserker resembles a Viking warrior, wearing a helmet-like headpiece and sporting a long, golden beard. Its body is covered in dense, metallic fur, providing it with natural armor. Perrserker is highly skilled in battle, wielding a powerful battle axe made of hardened steel.

Cursola, the Coral Pokémon. It is a Ghost type. Cursola is the evolved form of Corsola and is known for its delicate and fragile appearance. Its body is made entirely of coral, with vibrant colors that change depending on its emotions. Cursola is often found in deep-sea regions and has the ability to regenerate its coral if damaged.

Sirfetch'd, the Wild Duck Pokémon. It is a Fighting type. Sirfetch'd is a gallant and chivalrous Pokémon that wields a leek stalk as its trusted weapon. It is known for its impressive sense of honor and rarely resorts to dirty tactics in battle. Sirfetch'd is constantly training to improve its skills and is always seeking out strong opponents.

Mr. Rime, the Comedian Pokémon and the evolved form of Mr. Mime. It is an Ice/Psychic type. Mr. Rime is a well-dressed Pokémon that wears a top hat and carries a cane. It is known for its amusing and entertaining performances, using its amazing ice-based abilities to create dazzling and hilarious shows. Despite its elegant appearance, Mr. Rime is also a formidable battler with powerful psychic powers.

Runerigus, the Grudge Pokémon and the evolved form of Galarian Yamask. It is a Ground/Ghost type. Runerigus resembles a decaying sarcophagus with eerie glowing eyes and ancient inscriptions. Legends say that it was formed when a Yamask possessed a trapped spirit. Runerigus is known for carrying grudges from the past and curses anyone who disturbs its territory. It can also manipulate the desert sands to trap and confuse its opponents.

Milcery, the Cream Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Milcery appears as a small, creamy-white blob with a sweet aroma. Its body is made of a soft and pliable substance that can change flavors depending on its diet. Milcery is often found near sweet and sugary foods. When it spins around rapidly, it creates a fluffy and delicious whipped cream that it uses as a defense mechanism.

Alcremie, the Cream Pokémon and the evolved form of Milcery. It remains a Fairy type. Alcremie is an elegant and whimsical Pokémon resembling a tall, colorful cake. Its body is made of a light and fluffy cream that tastes different depending on its decoration and toppings. Alcremie uses its sweet scent to calm and soothe others. It is also known for performing graceful dances during special occasions.
