Falinks, the Formation Pokémon. It is a Fighting type. Falinks is a unique Pokémon that resembles a group of six small soldiers lined up in a rigid formation. These soldiers are highly disciplined and fight as one unit. Falinks demonstrates incredible teamwork and coordination in battle, each soldier performing its role to perfection. Despite their small size, Falinks can pack a powerful punch and march forward relentlessly to defeat their opponents.

Pincurchin, the Sea Urchin Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Pincurchin resembles a small, blue and yellow sea urchin, with long spines protruding from its body. These spines are capable of conducting electricity, making them both offensive and defensive weapons. Pincurchin can emit electric currents to paralyze its opponents or charge up its own attacks.

Snom, the Worm Pokémon. It is a Ice/Bug type. Snom has a small body covered in white fur, resembling a tiny larva. Despite its timid appearance, it can unleash icy power when threatened. Snom has an organ that produces a freezing secretion, which it uses to create intricate patterns on the surface of objects or to freeze its prey.

Frosmoth, the Frost Moth Pokémon and the evolved form of Snom. It remains a dual-type Ice/Bug Pokémon. Frosmoth has a graceful and ethereal appearance, with wings resembling snowflakes. It can generate subzero temperatures and create blizzards by flapping its wings. Frosmoth is known for its beauty and often attracts admirers with its mesmerizing glow.

Stonjourner, the Big Rock Pokémon. It is a Rock type. Stonjourner is a massive, standing stone Pokémon with a sturdy body. It is often found in rocky mountain areas. Stonjourner's body is composed of multiple rocks that it can rearrange to adapt to different environments. It has an inner energy core that allows it to move slowly but with great force.

Eiscue-Ice, the Penguin Pokémon. It is an Ice type, specifically the Ice Face form of Eiscue. Eiscue-Ice has a spherical icy head, resembling an ice cream. This ice serves as a mask to protect its face from the harsh cold. Eiscue likes to slide down icy slopes using its stomach. Its icy head can shatter upon impact, revealing a new Ice Face beneath.

Indeedee (male), the Emotion Pokémon. It is a dual-type Psychic/Normal Pokémon. The male Indeedee has a slender body with a primarily purple coloration and a white face. It is known for its exceptional focused and calm demeanor. As a psychic Pokémon, Indeedee is skilled in telepathy and uses its psychic abilities to support and protect its allies.

Morpeko (Full Belly), the Two-Sided Pokémon. It is an Electric/Dark type. Morpeko has two distinct forms, and the Full Belly form is characterized by its cheerful and content demeanor. While in Full Belly form, Morpeko's constant snacking keeps its hunger satisfied and enables it to unleash powerful Electric-type moves during battles.

Cufant, the Copperderm Pokémon. It is a Steel type. Cufant has a strong and sturdy body covered in thick copper-colored hide. Its large tusks are highly prized for their durability and beauty. Cufant is often used in heavy labor due to its incredible strength and is known for its loyalty and dedication.

Copperajah, the Copperderm Pokémon and the evolved form of Cufant. It remains a Steel type. Copperajah boasts a massive size and incredible physical strength. Its body is covered in intricately designed copper plating that not only protects it but also conducts electricity. Copperajah is highly revered for its power and is often seen as a symbol of strength and prosperity.

Dracozolt, the Fossil Pokémon. It is a dual-type Electric/Dragon Pokémon. Dracozolt is a unique Pokémon revived from a combination of fossilized remains. It has a mix of dragon-like features and an electrifying presence. Dracozolt harnesses the power of electricity to attack its opponents with powerful electric moves, making it a fearsome and formidable adversary in battles.

Arctozolt, the Fossil Pokémon. It is an Electric/Ice type. Arctozolt is an amalgamation of ancient Electric and Ice types that were fused together through a scientific experiment. It has a bulky body with mismatched limbs and a pronounced jaw. Arctozolt generates electricity from the ice on its body and is capable of delivering potent electric shocks to its opponents.

Dracovish, the Fossil Pokémon. It is a Water/Dragon type. Dracovish is the result of the fusion of ancient Water and Dragon types. It has a unique appearance with a fish-like lower body and a dragon-like upper body. Dracovish has a powerful bite that can crush even the toughest armor. It can expel a high-velocity stream of water from its mouth, capable of piercing through steel.

Arctovish, the Fossil Pokémon. It is a Water/Ice type. Arctovish is the combination of an ancient Water and Ice type. It has a peculiar body shape with a fish-like lower body and a bulky ice head. Arctovish can emit intense cold from its head, freezing its surroundings. It can swim at astonishing speeds, slicing through the water with ease.

Duraludon, the Alloy Pokémon. It is a Steel/Dragon type. Duraludon has a unique metallic body that resembles a skyscraper. It is primarily made of an exceptionally durable steel alloy, which provides excellent protection against physical attacks. Duraludon's body also possesses an innate ability to generate energy beams from its arms, which it uses to defend itself and attack enemies.

Dreepy, the Stealth Pokémon. It is a Dragon/Ghost type. Dreepy is a small, ghostly Pokémon that resembles a floating, purple skull with small wings. It is known for its ability to hide in the shadows and avoid detection. Dreepy tends to stay in dark places during the day and becomes more active during the night. It can use its horn to emit a peculiar sound that disrupts the surroundings and confuses its opponents.

Drakloak, the Stealth Pokémon, is a Dragon/Ghost type Pokémon. It is the evolved form of Dreepy. Drakloak appears as a small, ghostly dragon with a long, flowing mane. It possesses remarkable agility and the ability to phase through solid objects. Drakloak is known for its sly and mischievous nature, often hiding in shadows and surprising unsuspecting prey.

Dragapult, the Stealth Pokémon, is a Dragon/Ghost type Pokémon. It is the final evolved form of Dreepy. Dragapult is an imposing dragon with sleek, aerodynamic features. It possesses incredible speed and maneuverability, allowing it to swiftly outmaneuver opponents. Dragapult's signature move is Dragon Darts, which launches multiple ghostly missiles at its enemies with pinpoint accuracy.

Zacian, the Crowned Sword Pokémon, is a Fairy/Steel type Pokémon. It is known as a legendary hero and possesses a majestic and regal appearance. Zacian wields a sacred sword in its mouth, which it uses to defend the weak from any threats. Its incredible speed and grace make it nearly unbeatable in battle. Legends say that Zacian can cut through anything with its sharp blade.

Zamazenta, the Crowned Shield Pokémon, is a Fighting/Steel type Pokémon. Zamazenta is a legendary protector known for its indomitable defense and unwavering bravery. It possesses a majestic shield on its back, which it uses to ward off any attacks. Zamazenta's endurance is unrivaled, and it can withstand even the most powerful blows. Legends tell of its willingness to sacrifice itself to protect others.

Eternatus, the Gigantic Pokémon, is a Poison/Dragon type Pokémon. It is an ancient and incredibly powerful creature that is said to have brought calamity to the Galar region long ago. Eternatus has a serpentine body with multiple heads and wings, giving it a fearsome appearance. Its signature move, Dynamax Cannon, can unleash devastating energy blasts capable of causing massive destruction.

Kubfu, the Wushu Pokémon. It is a Fighting type. Kubfu is a small, bear-like Pokémon with a white body and a round head. It possesses remarkable physical strength and trains hard to become even stronger. Kubfu's determination and discipline make it an excellent student of martial arts. It evolves into Urshifu.

Urshifu Single Strike Style, the Wushu Pokémon. It is a Fighting/Dark type and the evolved form of Kubfu. Urshifu Single Strike Style is a towering Pokémon with a muscular build. It excels in using dark energy and its powerful punches can split massive boulders. Urshifu Single Strike Style is a formidable fighter that can take down opponents with a single blow.

Zarude, the Rogue Monkey Pokémon. It is a Dark/Grass type. Zarude is a large primate-like Pokémon with dark fur covering its body. It lives deep in the dense forests and moves swiftly through the trees using its long, vine-like arms. Zarude can manipulate vines to battle and to swing from branch to branch. It is protective of its pack and will fiercely defend them.

Regieleki, the Electron Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Regieleki is a legendary Pokémon that appears like a living electric current, with a lightning bolt-shaped body and a glowing core. It moves at incredible speeds and possesses immense electrical power. Regieleki can draw electricity from the atmosphere and release it in the form of destructive lightning blasts.

Regidrago, the Dragon Orb Pokémon. It is a Dragon type. Regidrago is a legendary Pokémon that takes the form of a large, draconic creature with a golden body covered in intricate patterns. It has powerful wings that allow it to fly at high speeds and can unleash devastating dragon-type attacks. Regidrago's body holds a dragon orb that enhances its power.

Glastrier, the Wild Horse Pokémon. It is an Ice type. Glastrier resembles an icy horse with a powerful and muscular build. Its body is covered in crystalline ice that can withstand extreme cold temperatures. Glastrier's signature ability, Chilling Neigh, allows it to lower the speed stats of its opponents with its icy cries.

Spectrier, the Swift Horse Pokémon. It is a Ghost type. Spectrier has a slender and graceful appearance, resembling a ghostly horse. Its ethereal mane and tail flow elegantly, even without any wind. Spectrier's ability, Grim Neigh, allows it to drain the HP of its opponents with its haunting neighs.

Calyrex, the King Pokémon. It is a Psychic/Grass type. Calyrex is a legendary Pokémon known for its wisdom and intelligence. It has a regal and graceful appearance, wearing a crown-like structure on its head. Calyrex's ability, Unnerve, makes its opponents too nervous to eat Berries during battle.

Wyrdeer, the Mystical Stag Pokémon. It is a Fairy/Grass type and the evolved form of Gossifleur. Wyrdeer exudes an elegant and majestic aura, with large antlers adorned with beautiful flowers. Its ability, Serene Grace, enhances the likelihood of additional effects occurring from its moves.

Kleavor, the Jewel Beetle Pokémon. It is a Bug/Rock type and the evolved form of Crustle. Kleavor has a dazzling appearance, with a body covered in colorful gemstones. Its strong pincers can easily crush rocks and its tiny wings allow it to hover briefly. Kleavor's ability, Sturdy, prevents it from getting knocked out in one hit.

Ursaluna, the Lunar Pokémon. It is a Fairy/Ice type. Ursaluna resembles a bear, with a body covered in fluffy white fur. Its most striking feature is the large crescent moon on its forehead. This Pokémon has powerful moon-based abilities, able to control moonlight to heal and protect itself and its allies.

Basculegion (Male), the Brightscale Pokémon. It is a Water/Flying type. Basculegion is a magnificent sea creature with a unique appearance. The male variant has vibrant blue scales and long fins on its head and tail. It is known for its agile flying and swift swimming abilities, making it a formidable opponent both in the air and underwater.

Sneasler, the Shadow Sneak Pokémon. It is a Dark/Ghost type. Sneasler is a sneaky and elusive Pokémon that roams in the shadows. Its body is slender and black, with piercing red eyes and sharp claws. Sneasler has the ability to move silently and blend into the darkness, making it an expert at surprise attacks.

Overqwil, the Thunderbolt Pokémon. It is an Electric/Flying type. Overqwil is a majestic bird Pokémon with a striking appearance. Its feathers are a vivid combination of blue and yellow, giving it a thunderstorm-like appearance. This Pokémon can generate powerful electric currents, which it channels through its wings to create dazzling displays of lightning and thunder.

Enamorus (Incarnate), the Melody Pokémon. It is a Normal/Fairy type. Enamorus is a graceful and elegant Pokémon known for its melodic voice. Its body is adorned with colorful ribbons and its long ears resemble musical notes. Enamorus has the power to soothe and calm others with its enchanting voice, making it a beloved companion.

Sprigatito, the Leaf Kitten Pokémon. It is a Grass type. Sprigatito is a small feline Pokémon with a green, leaf-like fur coat. It has large, round eyes and a playful demeanor. This Pokémon is often found frolicking in fields and climbing trees. Its grassy fur allows it to blend seamlessly into its natural surroundings and provides protection against predators.

Floragato, the Blossom Cat Pokémon. It is the evolved form of Sprigatito and remains a Grass type. Floragato is a graceful Pokémon with long, flowing green fur that resembles leaves. It possesses beautiful flower-like markings on its body and a vibrant blossom adorning its forehead. This Pokémon emits a soothing aroma, which is said to have healing properties.

Meowscarada, the Disguise Cat Pokémon. It is a Dark type. Meowscarada is a mischievous Pokémon that enjoys playing pranks on others. It has a sleek black coat with intricate markings resembling a theatrical mask. Meowscarada is known for its ability to transform into different objects and creatures, allowing it to blend seamlessly into its surroundings and deceive its opponents.

Fuecoco, the Ember Nut Pokémon. It is a Fire type. Fuecoco is a small Pokémon resembling a coconut with flames flickering from the top. It has a tough outer shell that can withstand high temperatures. Fuecoco's flames are constantly fueled by the nut inside its shell, providing warmth and protection. This Pokémon is known for its fiery personality and its ability to shoot small fireballs.

Crocalor, the Blaze Crocodile Pokémon. It is the evolved form of Fuecoco and remains a Fire type. Crocalor is a powerful Pokémon with a fearsome appearance. It has a scaly, armored body and a flaming mane-like crest on its head. Crocalor's strong jaws can crush almost anything, and its long tail can whip opponents with intense heat. This Pokémon is often found near volcanoes, basking in the heat.

Skeledirge, the Bone Pokémon. It is a Ghost type. Skeledirge is a skeletal Pokémon with a ghostly appearance. Its bones are covered in a sinister aura, and it is said to be the spirit of a Pokémon that met a tragic fate. Its haunting presence instills fear in those who cross its path.

Quaxly, the Water Bird Pokémon. It is a Water/Flying type. Quaxly resembles a colorful duck with vibrant feathers and a graceful demeanor. It is known for its remarkable swimming abilities and elegant flight. Quaxly can dive into water from great heights to catch its prey, making it a skilled hunter.

Quaxwell, the Water Bird Pokémon and the evolved form of Quaxly. It remains a dual-type Water/Flying Pokémon. Quaxwell has grown larger and more majestic than its previous form. Its feathers have developed intricate patterns, making it a beautiful sight to behold. Quaxwell possesses enhanced speed and agility, allowing it to outmaneuver its opponents in battle.

Quaquaval, the Water Bird Pokémon and the final evolved form of Quaxly. It is still a Water/Flying type Pokémon. Quaquaval is a magnificent creature with a regal appearance. It boasts vibrant plumage and a powerful presence. Quaquaval is known for its ability to create powerful water currents with just a flap of its wings, which it utilizes to defend itself and its territory.

Lechonk, the Heavyweight Pokémon. It is a Normal type. Lechonk is a large and heavy-hearted Pokémon that resembles a pig. It possesses immense strength and a hearty appetite. Despite its size, Lechonk is surprisingly agile, able to move swiftly when needed. Its presence is often associated with abundance and prosperity.

Oinkologne, the Piglet Pokémon. It is a Normal type. Oinkologne is a small, pink pig Pokémon with a curly tail. Known for its delightful snorts and playful nature, Oinkologne can often be found rolling around in mud patches. It is highly sociable and enjoys being around other Pokémon.

Tarountula, the Venom Tarantula Pokémon. It is a Bug/Poison type. Tarountula is a large and intimidating Pokémon, resembling a giant tarantula. Spidops, the Spy Spider Pokémon. It is a Bug/Dark type. Spidops is a stealthy Pokémon that dwells in dark corners and weaves intricate webs. Nymble, the Agile Pokémon. It is an Electric/Flying type. Nymble is a small and energetic Pokémon, known for its incredible speed and agility. With its electrically charged wings, Nymble can dart through the air with lightning-fast movements. It emits small sparks that serve as a warning to potential predators.

Lokix, the Mischievous Pokémon. It is a Dark/Fairy type. Lokix is a small and cunning Pokémon, often causing playful chaos wherever it goes. Pawmi, the Playful Pokémon. It is a Fairy type. Pawmi is a small, cat-like Pokémon with soft pink fur and twinkling blue eyes. It has a playful and mischievous nature, often seen frolicking and chasing its own tail. Pawmi uses its signature move, Paw Play, to entertain and amuse its trainer during battles.

Pawmo, the Graceful Pokémon and the evolved form of Pawmi. It remains a Fairy type. Pawmo's fur is now longer and more elegant, with a beautiful pink hue that seems to radiate with a subtle glow. Pawmo is known for its graceful movements and dances, which captivate its opponents and leave them in awe.

Pawmot, the Enchanting Pokémon and the final evolution of Pawmi. It is a Fairy/Ghost type. Pawmot has grown even larger and more mysterious than its previous forms. Tandemaus, the Agile Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Tandemaus is a small, mouse-like Pokémon with bright yellow fur and long, slender legs that allow it to move with incredible speed and agility. Maushold, the Electric Bolt Pokémon and the evolved form of Tandemaus. It remains an Electric type. Fidough, the Dough Pokémon. It is a unique Bread type Pokémon. Fidough is made entirely out of dough, with a plump and round body. It is known for its delicious aroma and soft texture. Fidough is highly sought after by bakers and chefs for its ability to enhance the flavors of baked goods.

Dachsbun, the Bun Pokémon. It is a Normal type Pokémon. Dachsbun resembles a small, fluffy bun with adorable ears and a long, brown tail. It is quite playful and enjoys hopping around in search of tasty treats. Dachsbun is also known for its remarkable speed and agility.

Smoliv, the Olive Pokémon. It is a Grass type Pokémon. Smoliv is a small, green Pokémon that closely resembles an olive. It has a round body and a pair of small, leaf-like wings. Smoliv is known for its healing properties, as its leaves can be used to create soothing ointments and remedies.

Dolliv, the Blossom Pokémon and the evolved form of Smoliv. It remains a Grass type Pokémon. Dolliv has transformed into a larger and more elegant version of Smoliv. Arboliva, the Tree Pokémon and the final evolution of Dolliv. It is a majestic Grass type Pokémon. Arboliva stands tall and proud, resembling a magnificent tree with branches extending to the sky. Squawkabilly, the Melodic Pokémon. It is a Normal/Flying type. Squawkabilly is a small bird Pokémon with vibrant feathers and a tuneful voice. Nacli, the Sodium Pokémon. It is a Water type. Nacli is a small, aquatic Pokémon that resembles a drop of water. It has the ability to manipulate the concentration of salt in its body, which it uses for self-defense. Nacli is commonly found in coastal areas and has a gentle disposition.

Naclstack, the Salt Column Pokémon. It is a Water/Rock type. Naclstack evolves from Nacli and has grown into a taller and sturdier form. Garganacl, the Briny Gargoyle Pokémon. It is a Water/Rock type. Garganacl is an imposing Pokémon with a rock-like body covered in barnacles and corals. Charcadet, the Charcoal Pokémon. It is a Fire type. Charcadet is a small, lizard-like Pokémon with a charcoal-black body covered in ash. It is highly energetic and possesses a playful nature. Armarouge, the Armadillo Pokémon. It is a Ground type. Armarouge is known for its sturdy armor-like skin, which protects it from external threats. Ceruledge, the Cerulean Pokémon. It is a Water type. Ceruledge is characterized by its vibrant blue color and its graceful swimming movements. Tadbulb, the Tadpole Pokémon. It is a Water type. Tadbulb is the first stage of its evolutionary line and is known for its small, round body and large, expressive eyes. Bellibolt, the Electric Bell Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Bellibolt has a unique appearance, with its body resembling a bell. Kilowattrel, the Electric Volt Pokémon. It is an Electric type. Kilowattrel is known for its vibrant electric blue fur, which emits small sparks of electricity when charged up. Maschiff, the Fierce Fighter Pokémon. It is a Fighting type. Maschiff possesses a muscular build and a determined expression on its face. Mabosstiff, the Savage Ruffian Pokémon. It is a Dark/Fighting type and the final evolution of Maschiff. Mabosstiff has a brutal and intimidating appearance, with sharp claws and fierce crimson eyes. Shroodle, the Mysterious Illusion Pokémon. It is a Ghost/Psychic type. Shroodle has a whimsical appearance with a body covered in wispy, pink clouds. Grafaiai, the Majestic Vine Pokémon. It is a Grass/Fairy type. Grafaiai has a graceful and elegant presence, adorned with beautiful vines and flowers. Bramblin is a Grass type Pokémon. With a small and round body covered in prickly thorns, Bramblin resembles a walking bush. It uses its sharp thorns to ward off enemies and protect itself. Klawf is a Normal type Pokémon. It resembles a small rodent with large, sharp claws. Klawf uses its claws for various purposes, such as digging burrows and defending itself against predators. Capsakid is a Fire type Pokémon. It is known for its fiery red and orange fur, resembling the flames it generates. This mischievous Pokémon loves to play pranks by lighting small fires. Its playful nature can sometimes get it into trouble, so trainers need to keep a watchful eye on it.

Scovillain is a Dark/Flying type Pokémon. With its sleek black feathers and piercing red eyes, this Pokémon strikes fear into the hearts of its opponents. Rellor is a Water/Ground type Pokémon. It has a sturdy, turtle-like body covered in a thick blue shell. Rellor is known for its calm and patient nature, often seen meditating by the water's edge. Rabsca is a Grass type Pokémon. It has a small, rabbit-like body covered in vibrant green fur. Rabsca is highly skilled at camouflage, blending in perfectly with its grassy surroundings. Flittle is a Fairy type Pokémon. It resembles a tiny, glowing fairy with delicate wings and a radiant aura. Espathra is a Fairy-type Pokémon known for its graceful and elegant appearance. Its body is covered in shimmering, iridescent scales that give off a radiant glow. Cyclizar, the Cyclone Pokémon. It is a Flying type Pokémon. Cyclizar resembles a majestic tornado, with a swirling body and gusty winds. Its razor-sharp mandibles can slice through the toughest of materials, making it a dangerous opponent in battles. Miraidon is known for its sharp senses and strategic thinking.

Walking-Wake, the Water/Ghost type Pokémon. It is an enigmatic creature that resembles a ghostly shipwreck walking on water. With its ability to control the tides and summon eerie mist, Walking-Wake creates an unsettling atmosphere wherever it goes. This Pokémon is often seen lurking around coastal areas, drawing energy from the restless spirits of the sea.

Iron-Leaves, the Grass/Steel type Pokémon. It has a resilient body made up of sharp metal leaves that can withstand even the harshest conditions. Iron-Leaves' unique combination of grass and steel typing grants it versatility in battles. This sturdy Pokémon is often found in rocky areas, where it blends in seamlessly with its metallic surroundings.
